Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Model
Description: Elongated object that could have been the model of a stake. A long vertical shaft, tapered at the bottom is topped by a flattened circular head at its top extremity. It resembles a long nail. This object could be one of the stakes driven in the ground with a mace by the king and the goddess Seshat during the foundation ritual.
